thread.title: BREAKING: Police find man who disappeared after flying into Atlanta
thread.title_full: BREAKING: Police find man who disappeared after flying into Atlanta

author: Lauren Foreman
title: BREAKING: Police find man who disappeared after flying into Atlanta
text:
UPDATED [5:38 p.m.]: Police found Raymond Makowski, 55, in a wooded area they had already searched, Channel 2 Action News reported.
#Breaking : @Atlanta_Police have confirmed officers just found Mr. Makowski in a wooded area near Airport Blvd 14 hours after landing. üôèüèæ pic.twitter.com/U8ASd9theL
‚Äî Nefertiti J√°quez (@NefertitiWSB) February 20, 2017 ORIGINAL STORY: A Mattie‚Äôs Call has been issued for a man who went missing shortly after he flew into Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport, police said.
Raymond Makowski, 55, arrived in Atlanta just before 1:20 p.m. Sunday, police said.
After his United Airlines flight touched down at Hartsfield-Jackson, he disappeared.
Police have not said where Makowski came from.
According to Channel 2 Action News, he has dementia.
His brother-in-law reported him missing, police said.
Makowski is described as 6-foot-1, 165 pounds with gray hair and blue eyes.
Anyone with information about his whereabouts is asked to call Atlanta police.
